title: Complete Python Bootcamp
description: Master Python programming from scratch. Learn variables, functions, OOP, and build real projects.

tasks.title: FizzBuzz Challenge
tasks.description: Write a program that prints numbers from 1 to 100. For multiples of 3, print 'Fizz' instead of the number. For multiples of 5, print 'Buzz'. For multiples of both 3 and 5, print 'FizzBuzz'.
hints: Use a for loop to iterate from 1 to 100
Use the modulo operator (%) to check for divisibility
Check for multiples of 15 first (both 3 and 5)
testCases: Input: range(1, 101) ‚Üí Output: 1, 2, Fizz, 4, Buzz, ..., FizzBuzz

tasks.title: Palindrome Checker
tasks.description: Create a function that checks if a given string is a palindrome (reads the same forwards and backwards). The check should be case-insensitive.
hints: Convert the string to lowercase first
Compare the string with its reverse
You can use slicing [::-1] to reverse a string
testCases: is_palindrome('A man a plan a canal Panama') ‚Üí True

tasks.title: List Comprehension Exercise
tasks.description: Given a list of numbers, create a new list containing only the even numbers squared. Use list comprehension to solve this in one line.
hints: List comprehension syntax: [expression for item in list if condition]
Use the modulo operator to check if a number is even
Square a number using ** 2 or the pow() function

tasks.title: Dictionary Word Counter
tasks.description: Write a function that counts the frequency of each word in a given text string and returns a dictionary with words as keys and their counts as values.
hints: Split the text into words using .split()
Convert words to lowercase for accurate counting
Use a dictionary to store word counts
You can use dict.get(key, default) to handle missing keys
testCases: count_words('Python is great and Python is fun') ‚Üí {'python': 2, 'is': 2, ...}

tasks.title: Prime Number Generator
tasks.description: Create a function that generates all prime numbers up to a given number n. A prime number is only divisible by 1 and itself.
hints: Start by checking if each number is divisible by any number from 2 to its square root
Use a nested loop or create a helper function to check if a number is prime
Optimize by only checking odd numbers after 2
Consider using the Sieve of Eratosthenes algorithm for better performance

tasks.title: Class Implementation: Bank Account
tasks.description: Create a BankAccount class with methods for deposit, withdraw, and check_balance. Include proper error handling for insufficient funds and negative amounts.
hints: Use __init__ to initialize the account with a starting balance
Add validation to prevent negative deposits or withdrawals
Raise exceptions for invalid operations
Keep track of the current balance as an instance variable

title: React Native Masterclass
description: Build beautiful mobile apps with React Native. Learn components, navigation, and state management.

tasks.title: Custom Button Component
tasks.description: Create a reusable Button component with props for title, onPress, variant (primary/secondary), and disabled state. Use StyleSheet and TouchableOpacity.
hints: Import View, Text, TouchableOpacity, and StyleSheet from react-native
Define TypeScript interfaces for your props
Use conditional styling based on variant and disabled props
Apply different background colors for primary and secondary variants
testCases: Primary button should have a different color than secondary

tasks.title: Card List with FlatList
tasks.description: Build a scrollable list of cards using FlatList. Each card should display a title, description, and image. Implement pull-to-refresh functionality.
hints: Use FlatList component with data, renderItem, and keyExtractor props
Add RefreshControl for pull-to-refresh
Create a Card component to render each item
Use Image component from react-native for displaying images
testCases: List should render all items from data array
Each card should show title, description, and image

tasks.title: Form with Validation
tasks.description: Create a form with email and password inputs. Implement validation: email must be valid format, password must be 8+ characters. Display error messages.
hints: Use useState hooks for form values and error states
Create validation functions for email and password
Use TextInput with secureTextEntry for password
Show error messages conditionally using state
testCases: Password < 8 chars ‚Üí 'Password must be at least 8 characters'
Valid inputs ‚Üí No errors, form submits successfully

tasks.title: Dark Mode Toggle
tasks.description: Implement a theme context that allows toggling between light and dark mode. Update all component styles based on the current theme.
hints: Create a ThemeContext using React.createContext
Use useContext hook to access theme in components
Define color palettes for light and dark modes
Store theme preference in AsyncStorage
testCases: Toggle switch changes theme across all screens
Theme preference persists after app restart
All components use theme colors correctly

tasks.title: API Integration with Error Handling
tasks.description: Fetch data from a public API, display loading state, handle errors gracefully, and show retry option on failure. Use fetch or axios.
hints: Use useEffect hook for API calls on component mount
Manage loading, data, and error states with useState
Wrap fetch in try-catch for error handling
Create a retry function that re-fetches the data
Show ActivityIndicator during loading
testCases: Display data when API call succeeds
Show error message when API call fails

title: JavaScript Essentials
description: Learn JavaScript from the ground up. Master ES6+, async programming, and modern techniques.

tasks.title: Array Methods Practice
tasks.description: Given an array of numbers, use map, filter, and reduce to: 1) Double all numbers, 2) Filter even numbers, 3) Sum the result. Chain these operations.
hints: Use .map() to transform each element
Use .filter() to keep only even numbers
Use .reduce() to sum all numbers
You can chain these methods together

tasks.title: Object Destructuring
tasks.description: Create a function that takes a user object and returns a formatted string using destructuring. Handle missing properties with default values.
hints: Use destructuring in function parameters
Set default values with = in destructuring
Use template literals for string formatting

tasks.title: Promise and Async/Await
tasks.description: Create an async function that fetches data from multiple endpoints sequentially and returns combined results. Handle errors appropriately.
hints: Use async/await for cleaner asynchronous code
Use try-catch for error handling
Await each fetch call
Combine results using array methods or object spread

tasks.title: Closure and Currying
tasks.description: Implement a curry function that converts a function with multiple arguments into a sequence of functions each taking a single argument.
hints: Use closures to store previous arguments
Return a new function until all arguments are collected
Check the number of arguments needed
Use spread operator to collect arguments
testCases: const add = (a, b, c) => a + b + c

title: Java for Beginners
description: Start your Java journey. Learn OOP concepts, data structures, and build console applications.

title: C++ Programming
description: Master C++ programming. Learn pointers, memory management, and advanced concepts.

title: Data Structures & Algorithms
description: Master essential data structures and algorithms. Prepare for coding interviews.

title: Machine Learning Fundamentals
description: Learn machine learning basics. Build models with Python and scikit-learn.

title: Web Development Bootcamp
description: Complete web development course. Learn HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and build real websites.
